wmn4jnotation.noteobjects

Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • wmn4jnotation.noteobjects.Chord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Note>, Durational

    public class Chord
extends Object
implements Durational, Iterable<Note>
    Class for chords. This class should be used for chords where the notes are all of same length. For polyphonic textures add voices to the Measure. This class is immutable.
    Author:
    Otso Bj√∂rklund

    • Method Detail

      • getChord

        public static Chord getChord(Note... n)
        Get an instance of Chord with the given Note objects.
        Parameters:
        n - A non-empty and non-null array of Note objects.
        Returns:
        a chord with the given notes.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if notes is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if notes is empty or all Note objects in notes are not of same duration.

      • getChord

        public static Chord getChord(Collection<Note> notes)
        Get an instance of Chord with the given Notes.
        Parameters:
        notes - A non-empty and non-null Collection of Note objects.
        Returns:
        a chord with the given notes.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if notes is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if notes is empty or all Note objects in notes are not of same duration.

      • getDuration

        public Duration getDuration()
        Specified by:
        getDuration in interface Durational
        Returns:
        Duration of this.

      • getNote

        public Note getNote(int fromLowest)
        Get the Note with the fromLowest lowest pitch from this Chord.
        Parameters:
        fromLowest - index of note, 0 being the lowest note in the chord.
        Returns:
        the note from index fromLowest.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if fromLowest is smaller than 0 or at least the number of notes in this Chord.

      • getLowestNote

        public Note getLowestNote()
        Returns:
        the note with the lowest pitch in this Chord.

      • getHighestNote

        public Note getHighestNote()
        Returns:
        the note with the highest pitch in this Chord.

        public int getNoteCount()
        Returns:
        number of notes in this Chord.

        public Chord addNote(Note note)
        Get a Chord with the added note.
        Parameters:
        note - note to be Added.
        Returns:

        public Chord removePitch(Pitch pitch)

        Returns:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Check equality against Object o.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        o - Object against which this is compared for equality.
        Returns:
        true if o is an instance of Chord and contains all and no other notes than the ones in this Chord.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Get a String representation of this Chord. The string representation of chord is of form: [Note0, Note1, ...] where the notes are in order increasing order of pitch.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        string representation of this chord.

      • iterator

        public Iterator<Note> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Note>
        Returns:
        Iterator that can be used to iterate through the notes in this Chord. The Iterator does not support removing.
